findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE Employee agrees to maintain confidentiality of all trade secrets and proprietary information in perpetuity....
findings.exact_snippet: CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE Employee agrees to maintain confidentiality of all trade secrets and proprietary information in perpetuity
findings.context:
45,000, payable monthly.

3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All intellectual property developed by Employee in the course of employment shall be owned by Employer. Employee assigns all such rights to Employer.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
Employee agrees to maintain confidentiality of all trade secrets and proprietary information in perpetuity.

5. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION
Employee may not compete with Employer for 2 years after termination within the same geographic market.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Employer may terminate for

findings.title: Non-compete / non-solicit style restriction
findings.rationale: Restrictive covenants can limit future business activity; enforceability varies and is commonly negotiated.

findings.title: Short termination or notice windows
findings.rationale: Short or strict notice windows can lead to accidental renewals or unintended termination.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...6. TERM AND TERMINATION Employer may terminate for cause immediately. Employee may terminate with 30 days notice....

information in perpetuity.

5. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION
Employee may not compete with Employer for 2 years after termination within the same geographic market.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Employer may terminate for cause immediately. Employee may terminate with 30 days notice.

7. INDEMNIFICATION
Employee agrees to indemnify Employer for all legal costs resulting from Employee's breach, capped at $30
